net.marfgamer.jraknet

Class RakNetPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.marfgamer.jraknet.Packet
      • net.marfgamer.jraknet.RakNetPacket
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Acknowledge, ChatPacket, ConnectedPing, ConnectedPong, ConnectionBanned, ConnectionRequest, ConnectionRequestAccepted, CustomPacket, IncompatibleProtocol, NewIncomingConnection, OpenConnectionRequestOne, OpenConnectionRequestTwo, OpenConnectionResponseOne, OpenConnectionResponseTwo, UnconnectedPing, UnconnectedPong

    public class RakNetPacket
extends Packet
    A generic RakNet packet that has the ability to get the ID of the packet along with encoding and decoding.
    Author:
    Trent "MarfGamer" Summerlin

    • Field Detail

      • id

        private short id

    • Constructor Detail

      • RakNetPacket

        public RakNetPacket(int id)
        Constructs a RakNetPacket with the specified ID that will be written to it.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the RakNetPacket.

      • RakNetPacket

        public RakNetPacket(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buffer)
        Constructs a RakNetPacket that reads from and writes to the specified ByteBuf. On instantiation, the first byte of the buffer will be read and set as the ID.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the ByteBuf to read from and write to.

      • RakNetPacket

        public RakNetPacket(io.netty.channel.socket.DatagramPacket datagram)
        Constructs a RakNetPacket that reads from and writes to the specified DatagramPacket. On instantiation, the first byte of the datagram will be read and set as the ID.
        Parameters:
        datagram - the DatagramPacket to read from and write to.

      • RakNetPacket

        public RakNetPacket(byte[] data)
        Constructs a RakNetPacket that reads from and writes to the specified byte array. On instantiation, the first byte of the byte array will be read and set as the ID.
        Parameters:
        data - the byte array to read from and write to.

      • RakNetPacket

        public RakNetPacket(Packet packet)
        Constructs a RakNetPacket that reads from and writes to the specified Packet. On instantiation, the first byte of the buffer will be read and set as the ID unless the specified packet is a subclass of RakNetPacket.
        Parameters:
        packet - the Packet to read from and write to.
